channel.title: Hyperion help
channel.description: Yeah so I am back to RSPS and decided to use Hyperion. I have everything set up with net beans, but I am just sorta confused, because back when I used to own a server I learned where everything goes from client.java I think, but I can't find where anything goes on this. So pretty much can you point me into the right direction? Like what file the commands go in or what the main file is(sorta like client.java) and then from there I'll figure out the rest. Please don't tell me if I can not figure this out not to even use it, I don't wanna use any of that other shit

item.title: Hyperion help
item.dc:creator: @_synchronized ~synchronized
item.description:
@_synchronized wrote:

The Hyperion server is packaged making it much more organized then your average winterlove based servers; \src\org\hyperion\rs2. Not everything is cluttered into one single class.

Read full topic

item.title: Hyperion help
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

mclovinscape:

Damn you haha… Not that it matters but I think I was using something called devo 7. So should I just keep looking or…

Yeah, keep looking. Hyperion requires years of experience.

Read full topic

item.title: Hyperion help
item.dc:creator: @Racist_Turtle Racist Turtle
item.description:
@Racist_Turtle wrote:

Hate me if you wish, if you can’t figure out how to use it, don’t use it. You were using Delta before, which is very unstable and horribly programmed. Hyperion is the most stable and well programmed base out there right now I believe. It only comes natural with something like that will come confusing. I honestly can’t guide you in any way because Hyperion and Delta is like Night and Day.

Read full topic
